subject: Law
title: Marriage Equality: Obergefell v. Hodges
description: A 60-second lesson on Marriage Equality: Obergefell v. Hodges.

hook.text: Jim Obergefell's husband died. Ohio wouldn't recognize their marriage on the death certificate. He suedâ€”and won.

buildup.text: Obergefell v. Hodges (2015) ruled that same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marry under the 14th Amendment.

discovery.text: Justice Kennedy wrote that marriage is a fundamental right and denying it to same-sex couples violates equal protection.

twist.text: In 2004, only Massachusetts allowed same-sex marriage. By 2015, the Supreme Court made it the law of the land.

climax.text: The Respect for Marriage Act (2022) codified marriage equality in federal law as a backstop against future reversals.

punchline.text: Love won the legal argument. The Constitution caught up with the country.

quiz.question: What constitutional basis did Obergefell rely on?
